text: The fruit is inedible and very sticky Nesoluma polynesicum, the keahi or island nesoluma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is found in the Cook (New Zealand), Tubuai (French Polynesia), and Hawaiian Islands (United States). It is threatened by habitat loss. ==References== polynesicum Category:Flora of the Cook Islands Category:Flora of Hawaii Category:Flora of the Tubuai Islands Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Nesoluma polynesicum
